intro: Epicranthes adangensis, commonly known as the Adangensis skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
